question: I thought children in Virginia could enroll in FAMIS regardless of household income; why wasn’t my child automatically transferred to the FAMIS program when I submitted my application through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace?
text:
I thought children in Virginia could enroll in FAMIS regardless of household income; why wasnt my child automatically transferred to the FAMIS program when I submitted my application through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace?
          
        
Virginia's Insurance Marketplace makes it easy for you and your family to understand your coverage options regardless of what plans you qualify for. Once you submit a Virginia's Insurance Marketplace application and Virginia's Insurance Marketplace believes your child likely qualifies for free or low-cost FAMIS coverage, their application information will be sent to the Department of Medical Assistance Services (DMAS) to confirm. Virginia's Insurance Marketplace does not automatically send a child that is eligible for full-cost FAMIS directly over to DMAS to ensure that you can see their coverage options through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace.
